get.description:
Return the list of installed flows. Each flow can potentially be converted into a task. The response
includes details such as the name, display name, description, author, homepage URL, and other relevant
information about each flow.

schema.title: Response Flows Installed Api Flows Installed Get

get.description:
Return the list of flows that can be installed. This endpoint provides detailed information about each flow,
similar to the installed flows, which includes metadata and configuration parameters.

schema.title: Response Flows Available Api Flows Available Get

get.description:
Retrieves a list of flows designed to post-process the results from other flows, filtering by the type
of input they handle, either 'image' or 'video'. This endpoint is particularly useful for chaining workflows
where the output of one flow becomes the input to another. It modifies the main flow's structure by adopting
sub-flow's display name and selectively merging input parameters from the sub-flows into the main flow's parameters
based on matching names.

schema.title: Response Flows From Api Flows Sub Flows Get

put.description:
Endpoint to initiate the installation of a flow based on its name. This endpoint requires admin privileges
to perform the installation. If another flow installation is already in progress, it prevents a new
installation to avoid conflicts, returning a 409 Conflict HTTP status.

This endpoint schedules a background task for the installation process using the specified flow name. It
checks the availability of the flow in the list of available flows and starts the installation if the flow
is found. It ensures that no two installations can run concurrently.

parameters.name: name

schema.description: Name of the flow you wish to install
schema.title: Name

parameters.description: Name of the flow you wish to install

409.description: Another flow installation is in progress

example.detail: Another flow installation is in progress.

post.description:
Endpoint to initiate the installation of a flow from an uploaded file. This endpoint requires admin privileges
to perform the installation. If another flow installation is already in progress, it prevents a parallel flow
installation to avoid conflicts, returning a 409 Conflict HTTP status.

This endpoint schedules a background task for the installation process using the uploaded flow file.

409.description: Another flow installation is in progress

example.detail: Another flow installation is in progress.

delete.description:
Endpoint to delete an installed flow by its name. Requires administrative privileges to execute.
This endpoint will succeed even if the flow does not exist.

parameters.name: name

schema.description: Name of the flow you wish to delete
schema.title: Name

parameters.description: Name of the flow you wish to delete

get.description:
Retrieves the current installation progress of all flows from an in-memory dictionary. This endpoint
returns a dictionary showing the installation status for each flow.

Requires administrative privileges.

schema.title: Response Flow Progress Install Get Api Flow Progress Install Get

delete.description:
Deletes the installation progress entry for a specified flow.

Requires administrative privileges.

parameters.name: name

schema.description: Name of the flow progress you wish to delete
schema.title: Name

parameters.description: Name of the flow progress you wish to delete

204.description: Flow progress installation entry deleted successfully

404.description: Flow progress installation entry not found

get.description:
Returns the value as a string or an empty string if the setting is not found.

Default endpoint for retrieving settings.
User settings have higher priority than global settings.

parameters.name: key

schema.description: The key of the setting to retrieve
schema.title: Key

parameters.description: The key of the setting to retrieve

get.description: Retrieve the global setting value or an empty string if the global setting is not found.

parameters.name: key

schema.description: The key of the global setting to retrieve
schema.title: Key

parameters.description: The key of the global setting to retrieve

post.description:
Creates, updates, or deletes a global setting.

To delete a setting, specify an empty string as the value.
Access is restricted to administrators only.

get.description: Retrieve the user setting value or an empty string if the user setting is not found.

parameters.name: key

schema.description: The key of the user setting to retrieve
schema.title: Key

parameters.description: The key of the user setting to retrieve

post.description:
Creates, updates, or deletes a user setting.

To delete a setting, specify an empty string as the value.

Endpoint to initiate the creation and execution of tasks within the Vix workflow environment,
handling both file inputs and task-related parameters.

delete.description:
Removes a finished or errored task from the system using the task ID.
Access is limited to the task owner or administrators.

get.description: Retrieves the full tasks details information for a specific user. Optionally filter tasks by their name.

schema.title: Response Tasks Progress Api Tasks Progress Get

get.description: Retrieves summary of the tasks progress details for a specific user. Optionally filter tasks by their name.

schema.title: Response Tasks Progress Short Api Tasks Progress Short Get

get.description:
Retrieves the full task details of a specified task by task ID.
Access is restricted to the task owner or an administrator.

post.description:
Restarts a task specified by `task_id` if it has encountered an error or is not yet completed.
Only tasks that have errors can be restarted unless `force` is set to `True`,
which allows restarting any non-completed tasks.
This endpoint checks the task's current status and resets its progress, allowing it to be re-executed.
Access to this action is restricted to the task's owner or an administrator.

delete.description: Removes all finished or errored tasks associated with a specific task name, scoped to the requesting user.

get.description:
Retrieves a specific input file for a task, identified by `task_id` and `input_index`. This endpoint
allows access to input files regardless of whether the task is in queue or has finished. The input index
is used to select among multiple input files if more than one was provided for the task.
Administrators can access inputs of any task, while regular users can only access inputs of their own tasks.

Retrieves the result file associated with a specific task and node ID. This function searches for
output files in the designated output directory that match the task and node identifiers.
If the specific result file is not found, or if the task does not exist, 404 HTTP error is returned.

delete.description: Clears all unfinished tasks from the queue for a specific task name, scoped to the requesting user.
Removes a specific unfinished task from the queue using the task ID, scoped to the requesting user.

post.description:
Retrieves an incomplete task for a `worker` to process. Workers provide a list of tasks names they can handle
and optionally the name of the last task they were working on to prioritize similar types of tasks. If a
worker is associated with an admin account, it can retrieve tasks regardless of user assignment; otherwise,
it retrieves only those assigned to the user.

put.description:
Updates the progress of a specific task identified by `task_id`. This endpoint checks if the task exists
and if the requester is authorized to update its progress. If the task is not found or unauthorized,
a 404 HTTP error is raised, and `worker` should stop and consider the task canceled.

Saves the result files for a specific task on the server. This endpoint checks if the task exists
and if the `worker` making the request has the authorization to upload results.
If the task is not found or unauthorized, a 404 HTTP error is raised.

delete.description:
Unlocks a task specified by the `task_id`. This endpoint checks if the task exists
and if the `worker` making the request has the authorization to unlock it.
If the task is not found or unauthorized, a 404 HTTP error is raised.

get.description:
Fetches details about workers including their system and device information.
This endpoint allows filtering of workers based on their last active status and can also
retrieve information for a specific worker if a worker ID is provided.
Useful for monitoring and managing worker resources in distributed computing environments.

parameters.name: last_seen_interval

schema.description: The time interval in seconds within which workers must have marked themselves active. If specified, only workers who have reported activity within this interval will be returned.
schema.title: Last Seen Interval

parameters.description: The time interval in seconds within which workers must have marked themselves active. If specified, only workers who have reported activity within this interval will be returned.

parameters.name: worker_id

schema.description: An optional worker ID to retrieve details for a specific worker.
schema.title: Worker Id

parameters.description: An optional worker ID to retrieve details for a specific worker.

schema.title: Response Workers Info Api Workers Info Get

post.description:
Sets the tasks that a worker can work on. An empty list indicates that all tasks are allowed.
The administrator can set `tasks_to_give` for all workers, users only for their own.

Interrupts the currently executing task. This is primarily an internal function and should be used
cautiously. For standard task management, prefer using the `task_queue_clear` or `tasks_queue_clear`
endpoints. Requires administrative privileges to execute.

Shuts down the current instance of Vix. This endpoint queues a task to terminate the server process
after a short delay, ensuring any final operations can complete. Access is restricted to administrators only.

get.description: Returns information about the currently authenticated user.

save_path.title: Save Path
save_path.description: Subpath where the model is stored within the local system.

url.description: URL from which the model can be downloaded.

hash.title: Hash
hash.description: SHA256 hash of the model file for integrity verification.

regexes.title: Regexes
regexes.description: List of regex patterns that dynamically resolve model details based on workflow configurations.

gated.title: Gated
gated.description: Flag showing is the model closed to public access

AIResourceModel.title: AIResourceModel
AIResourceModel.description:
Represents an AI model resource within a Flow.

This model provides a structured way to handle AI
models that are integral to workflows, ensuring that each model can be dynamically
resolved, downloaded, and verified before use.

Flow.title: Flow
Flow.description:
Flows serve as add-ons to ComfyUI workflows, determining the parameters to be displayed and populated.
They also allow for the modification of ComfyUI workflow behavior based on incoming parameters.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the flow being installed.

flow.description: Parsed information about Flow in Visionatrix format.

flow_comfy.title: Flow Comfy
flow_comfy.description: The ComfyUI workflow which are installed.

progress.title: Progress
progress.description: The current progress of the installation, ranging from 0 to 100.

error.title: Error
error.description: Details of any error encountered during the installation process.

started_at.title: Started At
started_at.description: Timestamp when the installation process started.

updated_at.title: Updated At
updated_at.description: Timestamp of the last update to the installation progress.

finished_at.title: Finished At
finished_at.description: Timestamp when the installation process completed.

input_params.description: List of input parameters specific to this subflow, replacing the original flow's parameters.

SubFlow.title: SubFlow
SubFlow.description: A SubFlow modifies or extends a Flow by overwriting certain parameters like display_name and input_params.
